description: March 12, 2020: The Italian Ministry of Transport and Infrastructure, jointly with the Ministry of Health, has issued a ministerial decree (decreto ministeriale n. 112 del 12 marzo 2020) to close all airports except the airports of Ancona, Bari, Bologna, Cagliari, Catania, Genova, Lamezia Terme, Lampedusa, Milano Malpensa, Napoli Capodichino, Palermo, Pantelleria, Pescara, Pisa, Roma Fiumicino, Torino, Venezia Tessera (fully operative), and Roma Ciampino (only for governmental flights, transport of organs, Canadairs, and emergency services). The activities of the airports of Milano Linate, Bergamo Orio al Serio, Verona, Firenze, Roma Ciampino, Reggio Calabria, Brindisi, Trieste, and Treviso will be discontinued from March 14, 2020 (Milano Linate from March 16, 2020) until March 25, 2020. However, in all airports nationwide, operational activities such as cargo, postal services, governmental flights, and emergency services won’t be discontinued.
